ReportText: EXAM: CHEST 1 VIEW HISTORY: Chest pain. TECHNIQUE: Portable single upright AP view of the chest presented for interpretation. COMPARISON: None. FINDINGS: Heart: Heart magnified by the portable AP technique. Hila: Not enlarged. Mediastinum: Aortic knob atherosclerotic calcification. Lungs: Well aerated and appear clear. Pleura: Normal. No definite pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified radiographically. Other: Cardiac monitor leads overlie the chest. The trachea is midline in position. The soft tissues appear intact. Thoracic spine mild multilevel degenerative joint disease is present. IMPRESSION: No definite radiographic evidence of acute cardiopulmonary disease. Electronically Signed by: [[PERSONALNAME]] on 02/02/2019 10:57 AM #######################################
